meanings.definition: Keep (someone) in official custody, typically for questioning about a crime.
meanings.sent1: The police had to detain the suspect for further investigation.
meanings.sent2: The security guard will detain anyone who tries to enter without proper identification.
meanings.sent3: The detective accidentally detained the wrong person, causing confusion.
meanings.sent4: Her fear of spiders seemed to detain her in a state of panic.
meanings.sent5: The storm detained the travelers at the airport for hours.

meanings.definition: Keep (someone) from proceeding by holding them back or making them late.
meanings.sent1: Please detain the dog before it runs into the street.
meanings.sent2: Traffic congestion can detain commuters on their way to work.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppy tried to detain its owner by stealing their shoe.
meanings.sent4: Her curiosity about the book detained her from leaving the library.
meanings.sent5: The unexpected phone call detained him from attending the meeting on time.
